oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Engine Company No. 5 in Front of the Andrew Jackson Hotel, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1950, Vol. 1 p. 41
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Engine Company No. 5 in front of the Andrew Jackson Hotel during Clean-Up, Paint-Up, Fix-Up Week. Photographer unknown. Photograph used in a scrapbook for "Clean-Up, Paint-Up, Fix-Up Week," which took place from April 23-29, 1950. The event was originally sponsored by the Junior Chamber of Commerce and the Nashville Fire Department, and later became an event run by the City Beautiful Commission. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
